name: New Hall Hotel & Spa

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here In April on our Hand Picked loyalty points, so thankfully we didn't use hard earned cash to pay for this.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel, good breakfast but dreadful dinners in both restaurants

reviews.text: The hotel is a couple of hours from where we live and situated in a lovely park and very peaceful indeed. The grounds and surrounding areas are perfect for walking and New Hall could be a perfect retreat to escape to if it only got the restaurants right. The weekend of our stay they were horribly wrong.
reviews.title: Lovely stay

reviews.text: We ate in the "fine dining " restaurant on the first night. The first course of scallops were pathetic, rubbery, tiny pieces served on a bed of crunchy cous cous which tasted like gravel. My mackerel for main course was horrible, swimming in oil and served on a bed of watery spinach and practically raw butternut squash. My husband said his main course was good, but not exceptional. Having eaten very little I ordered a mousse with manderine sorbet. The sorbet was lovely but the mouse tasted of nothing but gelatin, more like a bad milk jelly than a mousse.
reviews.title: Stunning luxury getaway...

reviews.text: Dinner the following night in the less formal restaurant was a farce. My game late resembled wall paper paste and cardboard - it certainly tasted as if it could have been. I told our very inexperienced young waiter it was indelible and nothing was done. The couple at the next table ordered smoked salmon to start. Having had an enormous portion of smoked salmon at breakfast I thought they wouldn't be disappointed. When it arrived on a large white plate they got a minuscule Parcel of salmon probably 2 inches square in total. They called the maitre d' over and expressed their suprise at the size of the portion.
reviews.title: A lovely day and night ruined by a rude staff member and a complaint NOT followed up!!

reviews.text: We ordered steak as our main course, cant go wrong there we thought. Mine medium rare and my husbands rare. Mine arrived well done and my husbands's medium. I complained and they were taken back and replaced. The maitre d' said he would take the steak off the bill but when the bill arrived we had to request this again.
reviews.title: wheel chair access is not catered for even if they tell you beforehand

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I came with my Boyfriend for only one night back in November around the 14th. From start to finish the stay was amazing. The staff were so friendly and helpful, first class service. We so enjoyed our stay we are off to another handpicked hotel this weekend. The breakfast was out of this world and came on the dot of 9 to our door as we asked. Room and garden so pretty and very comfy. Please give the staff a big pat on the back. Was the prefect romantic get away from my birthday. Thank you.
reviews.title: Blown over!

reviews.text: Overall, we had a nice stay. Treatments were great and although the spa was separate from the hotel, it was nice, clean and staff were friendly.
reviews.title: Could do better

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: But some things were just a bit disappointing.. We arrived on Sunday afternoon and by the time we went down for a drink before dinner, the fires had been left to go out and the place was cold.
reviews.title: Disappointed on the whole :(

reviews.text: Our room was pretty average, having paid for an upgrade to an executive room - I think it was a bit bigger but that was it really.
reviews.title: Hotel lovely, but food let it down.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rypical handpicked really - could be amazing but just doesn't quite hit the mark
reviews.title: Fantastic wedding venue

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: me and my partner got married here last year and although the day was lovely and ran very smoothly it wasn't untill we got home after the wedding there was a letter from the poor wedding co-ordinator telling us that they had made a mistake with the cost of te wedding and that we owed them £1000 which they wanted immediatly.
reviews.title: not too happy

reviews.text: Word to the wise guys make sure you dont get ripped off too!!!!!!
reviews.title: fantastic friendly staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: just stayed at new hall hotel for a weekend. From the first email to book, right up to us leaving, the staff could not have been more frindly and accomodating. Beautiful hotel, great food. would definately recommend
reviews.title: Magnificent

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: From the stunning location to the absolutely magnificent room - room 56, a lounge bigger than the whole of my house and a separate bedroom off - to the attentive staff, this hotel ticks every single box.
reviews.title: Absolutly stunning

reviews.text: I was born and bred in Sutton, and since moving away this is the only place that I have wanted to stay at out of all the options in the town. This was actually my second visit, the first being around a year ago. Unfortunately this time we weren't at the hotel for long, and therefore can't comment on the leisure club or restaurant, but all I will say is that if you're looking to impress that special someone then this is definitely the hotel to bring them to.
reviews.title: Lovely venue terrible food.

reviews.text: I stayed for 1 Night only in March, The rooms very Nice and Modern. and away from Busy streets. The food is very good.. Service Frist class. British Queen Elizabeth the Frist stayed.
reviews.title: Lovely Grounds, Quite, Dont Miss this Historic Hotel Near Brimingham

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: the Hall goes back to 1126 or so. Dont miss this if coming from the states. Weekend would great treat.
reviews.title: Beautiful and charming hotel - loved it!

reviews.text: We stayed at the New Hall for 3 nights at easter and were very impressed with the friendly and helpful staff, the lovely grounds and the character filled hotel. The food was good, great service, nice pool and spa, and everywhere was very clean. A well deserved 4 star hotel - not cheap but you definately get what you pay for. Cannot fault, thankyou for a lovely break.
reviews.title: A hidden gem on the outskirts of Birmingham
Charming hotel
reviews.text: Attended a friends wedding and this magical venue hosted the wedding reception.
What an amazing location- I believe this is one of the very few places in a moat.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel, great staff

description: Lying within 26 acres of mature, elegant grounds this hotel is widely reputed to be the oldest inhabited, moated manor house in England. Sympathetic renovation has provided up-to-the-minute facilities whilst retaining most of its medieval charm and character. Public areas with their fine panelling and mullioned stained-glass windows create a unique historical ambiance; the magnificent Great Chamber is particularly impressive.
